results.title: Right... from the start
results.creator_credit: John Julian, University of Melbourne and Queen Victoria Medical Centre
results.brief_description: This videotape is basically for training midwives and medical students and is about the principles of breastfeeding. Mothers are often subject to conflicting views and information about breastfeeding and this video tackles the problem.

results.title: Right to the point
results.brief_description: A sales training film showing the activities of the Sheaffer Pen Coy when switched to war production of military components, then the workmanship and quality that goes into the making of their pens and finally their marketing policies. Good use of close-up photography.
results.description: A sales training film showing the activities of the Sheaffer Pen Coy when switched to war production of military components, then the workmanship and quality that goes into the making of their pens and finally their marketing policies. Good use of close-up photography.

results.title: Right to Live: Who Decides?(Extract from '7 Waves Away')
results.brief_description: A ship has sunk leaving more people than its one lifeboat can carry. The ship’s officer makes the agonizing decision to sacrifice some lives to save others. The film poses questions about the dimensions of leadership and the morality of making life-and-deaeth decisions about others.

results.title: Right Through the Shearing Time
results.creator_credit: John Maybe, Trevor Stockley and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
This film features sheep shearing at Moree and Yass, in New South Wales, and provides extensive information about this distinctive Australian industry. It also shows the life of the seasonal workers who are employed in this rural activity.

results.title: Right out of history: Judy Chicago's 'Dinner party'
results.creator_credit: Johanna Demetrakas, Thom Tyson and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: For five years Judy Chicago and four hundred artists and researchers worked to create a tribute to women of spirit and accomplishment whose names have been ignored by history. Film-maker Johanna Demetrakos followed their progress towards a work of unprecedented scale and beauty.
results.title_for_label: Right out of history: Judy Chicago’s ‘Dinner party’

results.title: Right of Privacy
results.creator_credit: Warren Steibel and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A report on the governmental and business activities which pose a threat to individual privacy today, and the possible elimination of all privacy should the National Data Centre be established. Officials speak out on the need to protect citizens. The National Sata Bank is discussed as a collection of statistics and as a potential threat to individual freedom.

results.title: Right Now
results.brief_description: Looks at the issues for families when their child has been diagnosed as having an obvious disability at birth. Families talk about their initial shock, sorrow and disappointment, illustrates how early intervention can assist by providing families with information, support, and practical guidelines for them with their child at home.

results.title: Right Here Right Now
results.creator_credit: Bruce Baker, Karl Holtsnider and Franciscan Communication Centre
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of how a janitor in an apartment house reaches out to those around him. His understanding brings hope to lonely tenants, and this is used to illustrate the need to be concerned for our fellow beings.

results.title: Right for the job
results.creator_credit: Peter Seabourne, Margaret K Johns and Liberatas Films
results.brief_description: Shows the training of an adult disabled person for a job in ordinary life, and a meeting between employers and others concerned who discuss the problems of employing disabled persons and helping them to succeed. Emphasises their determination to prove their usefulness and demonstrates that when given a job within their capabilities they compare favourably with other workers.

results.title: Right first time
results.brief_description: The introduction of modern methods of quality control to meet specifications of an important customer, and eventually reduce overall costs. Quality control concerns every stage of production - market research, raw materials, production engineering, manufacture packaging, distribution, and customer reaction.
